list: Forged steel head for superior durability
ProTouch grip for maximum comfort even after prolonged use
Smooth face leaves fewer marks on surfaces
Fiberglass construction absorbs vibration and reduces fatigue
Hybrid handle design is rounded for more comfort and fit with a curved base to prevent slippage and a hardened end cap

reviews.title: "Excellent general duty hammer"
reviews.text:
Very good feel. The ergonomic grip does make a difference & is surprisingly helpful.
Although I originally wanted a hammer solid forged shaft, I really couldn't recall or personally knew of a hammer head flying off. So, the value just wasn't there when comparing this fiberglass handle model's quality feel which is also a lighter load on my tool belt.
You know you made a good choice when you keep playing with the tool...and thats what Ive been doing with this hammer.
reviews.author: Karl

reviews.title: "terrible hammer"
reviews.text: After using this hammer for 5 minutes the head of the hammer was all dinged up and the shiny plastic coating was coming off. I plan on taking it back immediately.
reviews.author: Zachary

reviews.title: "Great tool"
reviews.text: Recieved this as Father's day gift from my preacher at Church today.
reviews.author: RussellOravec

reviews.title: "Great hammer, cheap price"
reviews.text: Great hammer for the value. I really like the flat claw more than the curved.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Chipping"
reviews.text: After driving just 2 nails with this new hammer the head is chipping out.The steel head is defective and not as strong as the nails.
reviews.author: Bil

reviews.title: "Why Was It Discontinued?"
reviews.text: I'm not sure why this product was discontinued but it was exactly what I was looking for. I'm not sure if it's because of the fiberglass handle but it has excellent balance. The claw is a lint strainer than typical hammers, which I like. Plus, the hammer face is smooth which prevents excessively marred wood for missed strikes. I know having a dimpled hammer surface is supposed to mitigate missed strikes, but that hasn't been my experience.
reviews.author: Joe

reviews.title: "Nice lighter weight hammer"
reviews.text: All I had was some heavy Estwing hammers at home but when I saw this on the shelf on sale I decided to pick one up and I ended up using it the next day on a room remodel and it was so nice to use and I love the grip with the slight ledge at the end so it will not slip out of your grip.
reviews.author: jm

reviews.title: "Works perfect"
reviews.text: I was going to go with a cheaper hammer but decided to spend a bit more and I'm glad I did. This one is heavy duty but is light enough for even a girl to swing away.
reviews.author: MrsBigKahuna

reviews.title: "Irwin living up to the legend"
reviews.text: Another great performing hammer from Irwin. Definitely worth the money. I would absolutely recommend this hammer to anyone pro or not.
reviews.author: Dysfunky1

reviews.title: "hanger for everyday"
reviews.text: I bought this hanger for those everyday needs of a handyman. Love the weight, and well balanced feel.
reviews.author: UncleJim

reviews.title: "Good product"
reviews.text: Good product would definitely buy again if needed for another property or camp
reviews.author: Chris

reviews.title: "16 oz hammer"
reviews.text: Highly recommended. Like it a lot. Bought 2 for using around the house
reviews.author: DavidT

reviews.title: "My hammer"
reviews.text:
I like the feel of the handle, well balanced
It also looks good
reviews.author: Charlie

reviews.text: Great hammer, has a handle that will fit to your hand.
reviews.author: Debbie

reviews.title: "Fiberglass Framing Hammer"
reviews.text: Its a hammer and it don't break like wood ones do.
reviews.author: TW

reviews.title: "Pound away..."
reviews.text: This hammer has excellent balance. Perfect nailer.
reviews.author: KGordon

questions.author: arbgnv

answers.author: hammerhead
answers.text: So yes - just look on the left side of aisle
